availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh W. Hopkins (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Washington Hopkins and Jane Wilson Hopkins. Married to Sarah A. Hudson Hopkins in Green County, Kentucky, on February 11, 1858. Father of Eliza L. Hopkins, Nancy E. Hopkins, and William Hopkins. Resident of Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal and sergeant from December 31, 1861, to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 100A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 561.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Precinct 2, p. 443B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Marriages.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0265.
"Rollingburg," The Adair County News (Columbia, KY), February 26, 1902, p. 2.
